title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
Hi guys,

A2159 with very minor liquid damage, most likely water. Cleaned in the ultrasonic twice.
No components are visually damaged, badly corroded or burnt. There were smoke traces of 20V short on the USB pcb connector.
Before cleaning there was no PD negotiation (5V, 0.4A). After cleaning, 20V is back.

Power on USB-C input is power cycling between 0.038 and 0.089A (20V). 
Using original 90W charger, also tested 65W original.

PPBUS_G3H 12.36V (slight dip to 12.26V every 3s)
PPDCIN_G3H 20.30V
PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS 20.30V (depending on which is connected)
PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS 20.30V ^
PP3V3_G3H_RTC 3.3V
PP3V3_G3H 3.3V (slight dip to 2.26V every 3s)
PP5V_G3S 0.02V jumps to 5V every 3 seconds or so, 21kOhm to gnd
Confirmed with scope it is exactly 3.5s, attempt to power PP5V_G3S on.

U7650 looks fine, but:
R7672 measures 0.945k (datasheet says 4.4k)
R7673 measures 0.945k (datasheet says 1.2k)
P5VG3S_CSP1 (pin 7) pulsing 5V, pin 8 same.

I have looked around various rails for shorts, but have yet to find anything suspicious.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
Onboard readings for resistors value are always lower than nominal value; in case of K/M range.

Do you get steady 3V3_G3S?
What about 1V8_G3S?
Also check all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages, if stable.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
3V3_G3S, 1V8_G3S both power cycling (can barely see blip with multimeter, would have to test with scope), both kOhms to gnd.
PP3V3_AWAKE 3.25V shows for about 1s, then 0 for 2s. PP1V8_AWAKE, PP1V8_SLPS2R same, 1.8V for 1s. All mOhm to gnd.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
So all power rails are pulsing.
Check for short on all big coils (from secondary supplies).

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message: The only coils near short are the CPU coils at around 3.4ohm, PVCCEDRAM around 30ohm, PVCCIO around 70ohm.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message: Can you catch any pulse on S3, or S0 power rails?

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
PP1V2_S3, PP1V8_S3 nothing
PP1V_S0SW nothing
PP3V3_TBT_X_S0, PP3V3_S0SW_LCD nothing

PP5V_S0_BKLT_A, PP5V_S0_BKLT_D:

[ATTACH type="full" width="439px"]60478[/ATTACH]

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
This is what PPBUS_G3H looks like:

[ATTACH type="full" width="468px"]60479[/ATTACH]

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
Remove audio board and check for liquid sign on both sides.
Also inspect audio flex and both connectors.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message: I'm doing all this with the logic board out of the case. Nothing connected except USB ports.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
And is dificult to check what I've asked you???
We need to know if T2 data lines might be affected for liquid spill on audio board.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message: Sorry, I misunderstood. Going to check the audio board in a bit.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message: [ATTACH]60482[/ATTACH]

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
Is that corrosion?
Check the other side, around audio amplifier.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message: Yeah, looks like very slight corrosion. The liquid sensor is red. I don't see anything else that looks bad/corroded.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
Leakage from PPBUS_G3H to T2 data lines is what probably happened.
In such case, it is garbage now.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message: Any way to make sure?

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
Wait, you have 01598 board, not 01958; mea culpa, sorry.
PPBUS_G3H doesn't go to J6600, but 16V for Touch ID.
If your picture is for Touch ID connector, from audio board, very likely that corrosion damaged T2.
Just in case, check diode mode to ground on T2 data lines, related with Touch ID; all of them have "MESA" in the name.
Compare with similar working board, if available.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
All of the MESA lines are mOhm, a few kOhm, but nothing to compare to.
I tried connecting the board to another Mac and interestingly it takes 4.91V and stable 0.45A (about 2W).
The only areas that get warm are under the can (U3900, northbridge?) and L7030 (CHGR_LX1), but nothing around CHGR_LX1 is shorted.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
U3900 is the f***g T2.

Do not use ohm scale when you check data lines to ground; diode mode is the way for comparison.

So no pulsing power on other shell?
Check all power rails above mentioned.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
So, connected to computer USB, input showing 4.91V, 0.3955A stable.

PPBUS_G3H 12.26V stable
PPBUS_HS_CPU 12.26V stable
PPDCIN_G3H 4.69V stable
PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS 4.87V stable
PP3V3_G3H_RTC 3.30V stable
PP3V3_G3H 3.23V stable
PP3V3_AWAKE 3.23V stable
PP1V8_AWAKE 1.8V stable
PP1V2_AWAKE 1.2V stable
PPVDDCPU_AWAKE 0.75V stable

PP5V_G3S 0.0V no pulse
PP3V3_G3S 0.0V no pulse
PP1V8_G3S 0.0V no pulse
PP1V2_S3 0.0V no pulse
PPVCCGT_S0_CPU 0.0V no pulse
P5VG3S_CSP1 0.0V no pulse

I don't know what the behavior should be on 5V and no battery, but I think it's okay it doesn't allow boot (correct me if I'm wrong).

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message: Test the board alone on the desk; nothing connected, apart of charger.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message: I'm doing all testing since the beginning with the board only.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
Machine can go into DFU with 5V from other machine; the one with AC2 installed.
Connection must be done through dedicated USB-C port.
You can use SE032 pads, to force it in DFU without keyboard.

If you connect normal USB-C charger, it should boot directly.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
Weird, I can't get any sign of life.
I tried USB-A to USB-C, both ports, with and without plugging charger in. Also tried connecting SE032 pads.
Then tried USB-C to USB-C (12" Macbook Retina), with and without charger, SE032 pads.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message: Did you get PPBUS_G3H and all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages?

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message: Yes. What I meant by "no sign of life" was on the USB. Nothing shows up in AC2.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message:
SE032 pads are usually used in case of no charger, only connection to AC2 machine.
If charger is connected, should go into DFU with keyboard, or SE032 pads.
There must be something wrong with T2, or corresponding USB-C port.

title: A2159 (820-01598) liquid damage, PP5V_G3S power cycles to 5V
message: Does the entire metal shield have to be removed to see the T2 or is it partially open when the black sticker is removed?
